query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Già eran li occhi miei rifissi al volto 2 de la mia donna, e l’animo con essi, 3 e da ogne altro intento s’era tolto.
query.result:
**English:**
1 My eyes were already fixed again on the face 2 of my lady, and my mind with them, 3 and it had withdrawn from every other thought.
**Cornish:**
1 O wrug o'm lagadow settys dhe'n dro dhe wyneb 2 a'm benenes, ha'm enef gansow, 3 ha'gas a bub tra voos o wrug kemerys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 E quella non ridea; ma «S’io ridessi», 5 mi cominciò, «tu ti faresti quale 6 fu Semelè quando di cener fessi:
7 ché la bellezza mia, che per le scale 8 de l’etterno palazzo più s’accende, 9 com’ hai veduto, quanto più si sale,
10 se non si temperasse, tanto splende, 11 che ’l tuo mortal podere, al suo fulgore, 12 sarebbe fronda che trono scoscende.
query.result:
**English:**
4 And she did not smile; but "If I smiled," 5 she began to me, "you would become like 6 Semele when she was turned to ashes:
7 for my beauty, which on the stairs 8 of the eternal palace grows brighter, 9 as you have seen, the higher one climbs,
10 if it were not tempered, shines so brightly 11 that your mortal power, in its brilliance, 12 would be like a leaf that a thunderbolt strikes down.
**Cornish:**
4 Ha hinas o kovsa; mes "Mar kovsaf vy", 5 hi a dhallathos dhym, "ty a vydh vel 6 Semele pan wrug hwra dhe losow:
7 rag an gwella'm, a wra dhe'n gresennow 8 a'n palas sempeternel moy a wra splanna, 9 vel ty a weles, moy a wra pyna,
10 mar nas wra temperys, kemmys yw splanna, 11 bythfos da gallos mortal, dhe'n splannder, 12 a vydh vel deilen a wra taran wra kwaya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Noi sem levati al settimo splendore, 14 che sotto ’l petto del Leone ardente 15 raggia mo misto giù del suo valore.
query.result:
**English:**
13 We have risen to the seventh splendor, 14 which beneath the breast of the fiery Lion 15 radiates mingled with its power below.
**Cornish:**
13 Ni a wrug sevel dhe'n sethves splannder, 14 a wra y'n splanna y'n-dann brest an Leon tan, 15 a wra splanna gans y gallus y'n-dann.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Ficca di retro a li occhi tuoi la mente, 17 e fa di quelli specchi a la figura 18 che ’n questo specchio ti sarà parvente».
query.result:
**English:**
16 Fix your mind behind your eyes, 17 and make of them mirrors to the image 18 that will appear to you in this mirror.
**Cornish:**
16 Settya da gol dhe lagadow dha enef, 17 ha wra dhe'n spegellow dhe'n delwedh 18 a wra dhe'n spegel ma parys dhe'n dro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Qual savesse qual era la pastura 20 del viso mio ne l’aspetto beato 21 quand’ io mi trasmutai ad altra cura,
22 conoscerebbe quanto m’era a grato 23 ubidire a la mia celeste scorta, 24 contrapesando l’un con l’altro lato.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Whoever knew what was the nourishment 20 of my face in the blessed aspect 21 when I changed to another care,
22 would know how pleasing it was to me 23 to obey my celestial guide, 24 weighing the one side against the other.
**Cornish:**
19 Pys a wydhvos pyth o an boes 20 a'm fas y'n an gwelen gwynvys 21 pan wra vy treylya dhe aral voes,
22 a wydhvos pyth o kemmys o lowena 23 dhe wosa dhe'm nessa sempeternel, 24 dhe wosa an dhew du dhe'n nessa aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Dentro al cristallo che ’l vocabol porta, 26 cerchiando il mondo, del suo caro duce 27 sotto cui giacque ogne malizia morta,
28 di color d’oro in che raggio traluce 29 vid’ io uno scaleo eretto in suso 30 tanto, che nol seguiva la mia luce.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Within the crystal that bears the name, 26 encircling the world, of its dear leader 27 beneath whom every evil lay dead,
28 of a golden color in which a ray shines through, 29 I saw a stairway rising up 30 so high that my sight could not follow it.
**Cornish:**
25 Y'n-mes an kristal a wra an hanow, 26 ow kelci an bys, a'y nessa ker, 27 y'n-dann a wra pub travos marow,
28 a liv our yn-dann a wra gweli skynn, 29 vy a welas onan gresen sevel, 30 kemmys na wra'm golwg ow hevel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Vidi anche per li gradi scender giuso 32 tanti splendor, ch’io pensai ch’ogne lume 33 che par nel ciel, quindi fosse diffuso.
query.result:
**English:**
31 I also saw so many splendors descending down the steps, 32 that I thought that every light that appears in the sky 33 was diffused from there.
**Cornish:**
31 Yth welyv vy dhe'n fordhow skenjya omwels, 32 kemmys splendowr, henna'm me a dheuth, 33 pub onen goleudh a wra y'n nef a-ugh, 34 a veu diffusdhyes owth ena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E quel che presso più ci si ritenne, 44 si fé sì chiaro, ch’io dicea pensando: 45 ‘Io veggio ben l’amor che tu m’accenne.
query.result:
**English:**
43 And the one that stayed closest to us, 44 became so bright that I said to myself, thinking: 45 ‘I see clearly the love that you show me.
**Cornish:**
43 Ha henna a veu nessa dhe'n fordh dhe nyn, 44 a wrug aga honen dellas kler, henna'm a leveris: 45 ‘My a wra'n gweles dellas an garow a wra'th owth vy.’

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Ma quella ond’ io aspetto il come e ’l quando 47 del dire e del tacer, si sta; ond’ io, 48 contra ’l disio, fo ben ch’io non dimando’.
query.result:
**English:**
46 But the one from whom I await the how and the when 47 of speaking and of being silent, remains silent; therefore I, 48 against my desire, do well not to ask.
**Cornish:**
46 Mes henna orth y'm eus an fordh ha'n jydh ha pan, 47 a wra'n leveris, a wra'n tos, henna'm a leveris: 48 ‘Orth an erbyn an dysyr, vy a wra dellas na'm eus dhe vyn.’

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Per ch’ella, che vedëa il tacer mio 50 nel veder di colui che tutto vede, 51 mi disse: «Solvi il tuo caldo disio».
query.result:
**English:**
49 Because she, who saw my silence 50 in the sight of him who sees everything, 51 said to me: “Fulfill your burning desire.”
**Cornish:**
49 Rag henna, a welas an tos vy, 50 y'n gweles henna a wra'n gweles pub tra, 51 a leveris dhe'm: “Gwrewgh an dysyr tomm.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E io incominciai: «La mia mercede 53 non mi fa degno de la tua risposta; 54 ma per colei che ’l chieder mi concede,
55 vita beata che ti stai nascosta 56 dentro a la tua letizia, fammi nota 57 la cagion che sì presso mi t’ha posta;
58 e dì perché si tace in questa rota 59 la dolce sinfonia di paradiso, 60 che giù per l’altre suona sì divota».
query.result:
**English:**
52 And I began: “My merit 53 does not make me worthy of your answer; 54 but for her who grants me to ask it,
55 blessed life that you remain hidden 56 within your joy, make known to me 57 the reason that has placed me so close to you;
58 and tell me why the sweet symphony of paradise, 59 which resounds so devoutly down through the others, 60 is silent in this circle.”
**Cornish:**
52 Ha my a dhallathas: “An bras vy 53 na wra'm dellas dhe'n fordh a wra dyw dhe'n fordh dhe leverel; 54 mes rag henna a wra'm owth leverel,
55 byw bethys a wra'th cusys 56 y'n kres an lowenner vy, gwrewgh dhe'm aswon 57 an acheson a wra'm owth settya dellas nessa dhe'm;
58 ha leverel dhe'm orth pyth yw an tos y'n henna rota 59 an sinfoni tomm a baradow, 60 a wra'n sonya dellas a-ugh y'n an erel?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 «Tu hai l’udir mortal sì come il viso», 62 rispuose a me; «onde qui non si canta 63 per quel che Bëatrice non ha riso.
query.result:
**English:**
61 “You have mortal hearing as well as sight,” 62 she replied to me; “therefore here there is no singing 63 because Beatrice has not smiled.
**Cornish:**
61 “Aga klow dhe'n fordh yw mortal dellas dellas aga golwg,” 62 a leveris dhe'm; “henna'm na wra'n kanys ena 63 rag henna na wra'th Beatrice owth chwerthin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Ma l’alta carità, che ci fa serve 71 pronte al consiglio che ’l mondo governa, 72 sorteggia qui sì come tu osserve».
query.result:
**English:**
70 But the high charity, which makes us ready 71 to follow the counsel that governs the world, 72 draws lots here, as you can see.
**Cornish:**
70 Mes an garowder uhel, ow th'aga ni serv 71 prest dhe'n keusel ow a'n govern an bys, 72 a sorsya ama ow a wellys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Né venni prima a l’ultima parola, 80 che del suo mezzo fece il lume centro, 81 girando sé come veloce mola;
82 poi rispuose l’amor che v’era dentro: 83 «Luce divina sopra me s’appunta, 84 penetrando per questa in ch’io m’inventro,
85 la cui virtù, col mio veder congiunta, 86 mi leva sopra me tanto, ch’i’ veggio 87 la somma essenza de la quale è munta.
query.result:
**English:**
79 I had not yet come to the last word, 80 when the light made its center of its middle, 81 spinning like a swift millstone;
82 then the love that was within it answered: 83 "Divine light is focused upon me, 84 penetrating through this in which I find myself,
85 whose power, joined with my sight, 86 raises me so far above myself that I see 87 the supreme essence from which it flows.
**Cornish:**
79 Nyns omos dhe'n lavar diwettha, 80 pan wrug an golon aga kres dhe'n kres, 81 ow treylya kepar mola bys.
82 Wosa henna an karanteth ow a'n bodh: 83 "Golon dywasel a wra warnan vy, 84 ow tremenya dre henna yn aga'm kavos,
85 aga gallus, ow kesunys gans ow gweles, 86 a'm gorra warnan vy dhe'n keth, ow'm wel 87 an essens ughella ow a wra dhe'n bys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Quinci vien l’allegrezza ond’ io fiammeggio; 89 per ch’a la vista mia, quant’ ella è chiara, 90 la chiarità de la fiamma pareggio.
query.result:
**English:**
88 From this comes the joy in which I am ablaze; 89 for to my sight, as clear as it is, 90 the brightness of the flame is equal.
**Cornish:**
88 A-dhyworth yma an lowena ow'm flammys, 89 rag dhe'n ow gweles vy, kepar hag yw kler, 90 an klerheth a'n flamm a wra parellow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ma quell’ alma nel ciel che più si schiara, 92 quel serafin che ’n Dio più l’occhio ha fisso, 93 a la dimanda tua non satisfara,
94 però che sì s’innoltra ne lo abisso 95 de l’etterno statuto quel che chiedi, 96 che da ogne creata vista è scisso.
query.result:
**English:**
91 But that soul in heaven that shines the brightest, 92 that seraph who has his eye most fixed on God, 93 will not satisfy your request,
94 because what you ask goes so deep into the abyss 95 of the eternal statute, 96 that it is cut off from every created sight.
**Cornish:**
91 Mes an eneval yn kever a wragh lowen, 92 an serafin na wragh lowen yn Dew an kever an golwg, 93 dhe ves na wra veth dhymmyn,
94 rag an peth a vynnys a wragh downder yn downder y’n downder 95 a’n statud sempiternel, 96 ha’n ayr a wra veth gwelys gans neb a veu grys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E al mondo mortal, quando tu riedi, 98 questo rapporta, sì che non presumma 99 a tanto segno più mover li piedi.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And to the mortal world, when you return, 98 report this, so that no one presumes 99 to set foot on such a path again.
**Cornish:**
97 Ha dhe’n bys marow, pan wra’th due, 98 dyllo wrapporti, lemmyn na wra presommi 99 dhe mosya an path ytho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 La mente, che qui luce, in terra fumma; 101 onde riguarda come può là giùe 102 quel che non pote perché ’l ciel l’assumma».
query.result:
**English:**
100 The mind, which shines here, smokes on earth; 101 therefore, consider how it can see down there 102 what it could not see because heaven exalts it.
**Cornish:**
100 An menowgh, a wragh lowen ama, yn-dann wragh moy ow, 101 rag henna, sel an fordh pyth ylli gweles ytho 102 an peth na alla bos rag an kever a’n syr y’n symmys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Sì mi prescrisser le parole sue, 104 ch’io lasciai la quistione e mi ritrassi 105 a dimandarla umilmente chi fue.
query.result:
**English:**
103 His words prescribed for me, 104 so that I left the question and humbly turned 105 to ask him who he was.
**Cornish:**
103 Ytho yma a-dro dhe’y ger, 104 ha’m gwhedhas an govyn ha mosya 105 dhe govyn yn umbel pyth ova.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 «Tra ’ due liti d’Italia surgon sassi, 107 e non molto distanti a la tua patria, 108 tanto che ’ troni assai suonan più bassi,
109 e fanno un gibbo che si chiama Catria, 110 di sotto al quale è consecrato un ermo, 111 che suole esser disposto a sola latria».
query.result:
**English:**
106 Between two conflicts of Italy rise rocks, 107 and not very far from your homeland, 108 so much so that the thrones sound much lower,
109 and they make a hump that is called Catria, 110 beneath which a hermitage is consecrated, 111 which is usually dedicated to solitary worship.
**Cornish:**
106 Ynter dew stryf Itali a wragh karrygi, 107 ha na wra brassa dowr dhyworth dhyw kar, 108 kyns na wra’n tronow a wragh moy ughel,
109 ha wra’th formya kromm henwysys Catria, 110 a-woles na wra ermitaas kensakrys, 111 a wra soedhys dhe vos orth latria hepken.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Così ricominciommi il terzo sermo; 113 e poi, continüando, disse: «Quivi 114 al servigio di Dio mi fe’ sì fermo,
115 che pur con cibi di liquor d’ulivi 116 lievemente passava caldi e geli, 117 contento ne’ pensier contemplativi.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Thus the third spirit began his speech to me; 113 and then, continuing, he said: “There 114 I became so devoted to the service of God,
115 that I passed through heat and cold with only food 116 made from the juice of olives, 117 content in my contemplative thoughts.
**Cornish:**
112 Ytho a dhallathas an sperys tresves dhe ger, 113 ha wosa, a-barhaus, a leveris: “Ama 114 y’m fethas kyns fest y’n servys Dew,
115 kyns pur gans boes a-dhyworth sugh olyv 116 y’m passyas yn es ha yen, 117 kontent y’n pennseri kontemplativ.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Render solea quel chiostro a questi cieli 119 fertilemente; e ora è fatto vano, 120 sì che tosto convien che si riveli.
query.result:
**English:**
118 That cloister used to render these heavens 119 fertile; and now it has become empty, 120 so that it must soon be revealed.
**Cornish:**
118 An kelli a wra gonisohe an nevov ma 119 yn fertil; ha lemmyn a wra gwrys vak, 120 kyns bys vythkyn ytho yma a wra diskudhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 In quel loco fu’ io Pietro Damiano, 122 e Pietro Peccator fu’ ne la casa 123 di Nostra Donna in sul lito adriano.
query.result:
**English:**
121 In that place I was Peter Damian, 122 and Peter the Sinner I was in the house 123 of Our Lady on the Adriatic shore.
**Cornish:**
121 Yn an le ma oen Pier Damiano, 122 ha Pier an Pehys oen yn an chi 123 a’n Vor Dhynner war an arvor adriatig.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Poca vita mortal m’era rimasa, 125 quando fui chiesto e tratto a quel cappello, 126 che pur di male in peggio si travasa.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Little of mortal life remained to me, 125 when I was asked and drawn to that hat, 126 which is constantly transferred from bad to worse.
**Cornish:**
124 Byghan byw marow oen dhe ves ow lelys, 125 pan owth пыs пыs ha owth пыs dhe’n kappel ma, 126 a wra soedhys dhe vos a-dhyworth drog dhe drog.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Venne Cefàs e venne il gran vasello 128 de lo Spirito Santo, magri e scalzi, 129 prendendo il cibo da qualunque ostello.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Cephas came and the great vessel 128 of the Holy Spirit came, poor and barefoot, 129 taking food from any inn.
**Cornish:**
127 Cefas a dhe’n les ma, ha’n les ma an les bras 128 a’n Sperys Sans, bohir ha bos, 129 ow tos bos a neb tavernel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Or voglion quinci e quindi chi rincalzi 131 li moderni pastori e chi li meni, 132 tanto son gravi, e chi di rietro li alzi.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Either I want someone here and there to encourage 131 the modern shepherds and someone to lead them, 132 so heavy are they, and someone to lift them up from behind.
**Cornish:**
130 Po dewisyth ow kwhi ha'gan owthow a wravyth 131 an moylyoryon a-lemmyn, ha'gan owthow a wravyth 132 kemmys yw, ha'gan owthow a wravyth a-dhiwrosa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Cuopron d’i manti loro i palafreni, 134 sì che due bestie van sott’ una pelle: 135 oh pazïenza che tanto sostieni!».
query.result:
**English:**
133 Their palfreys are covered with mantles, 134 so that two beasts go under one skin: 135 oh patience, that you endure so much!
**Cornish:**
133 Koberys a-dhiwrosa aga caballow, 134 marow best a-dhyskynnyn dan onen kroc: 135 oh pasyens, pyth a-dhiwrosa kemmys!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 A questa voce vid’ io più fiammelle 137 di grado in grado scendere e girarsi, 138 e ogne giro le facea più belle.
query.result:
**English:**
136 At this voice I saw more flames 137 descend and turn, grade by grade, 138 and each turn made them more beautiful.
**Cornish:**
136 Orth an lef a welas vy moy flammow 137 a-dhyskynna ha'gan a-droedha, 138 pub tro droedha moy brassa aga golow.
